comment: So.. I got an 89 in this class. You cant make over a 90 on his discussion posts in the NGO class and youre graded by a few things. Im sure hes a nice dude, but make sure you do well on all your assignments because one can make or break your final grade.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--So many papers

comment: This class was so hard, and it is basically built to where a top grade is a B. The discussion post is weighted most heavily - basicallty 50% of your overall grade, but the highest grade you can even make on them is a 90. This sets you up to where it becomes nearly impossible to make an A the moment you don't make a perfect disc. post.

I knew Id like Professor Pallas from day 1. This is a discussion based class instead of lecture based, which was a really nice change of pace. Hes extremely understanding about any personal things and just wants you to understand what hes teaching. The first half is learning and the second half is application. Also the essays are terrible for IA
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Outstandingly nice guy. Weekly discussions for the first couple of weeks, a few short essays, and a larger (2000 word) final essay. The class was on International Nongovernmental Organizations and I was really interested in the material. Virtually all the reading could be found via the library search function on d2l making it easy to do the work.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Really nice and very approachable. Engages in a lot of class discussion. Class has a lot of activities and group projects which are interesting. There were 2 essays and one test. Read all the assigned texts.

This was an awesome class with an awesome teacher. His teaching style is different (lots of group activities and discussions) but it was wonderful for this class. Read EVERYTHING he assigns, though. Don't be afraid to ask questions or visit his office hours. Great teacher.

Dr. Pallas is one of my favorite teachers. He is extremely knowledgable about IR, and he certainly does push you to learn the material. He wants the class to be engaged and separates the class into small groups for discussions. He also spent an hour+ with me in his office going over how to apply the theories to real world problems. Take him!
Not a good professor. Probably he is still young and unexperimented..or probably he is just not meant to be a teacher.

He has an over-inflated opinion about himself even though he is not even by far as knowledgeable as he thinks he is. Very unapproachable and with no pedagogical skills. One needs more than a PhD diploma to be a "teacher"

Attendance wasn't mandatory, but it helps your grade if you're there to participate. He definitely knows his material and tries to make sure his students understand. Grades papers a bit difficult, but allows a re-write on the midterm. Truly challenges you to apply the theories to analyze current events.
Overall pretty easy class. Nice guy. Knows what he is talking about.
